content:
• Wednesday, June 27, 2018
  • CMG

    Chipotle to take $115M-$135M charge for store closings in restructure

    • Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG) -3.3% after-hours on plans to take $115M-$135M in non-recurring charges, including $50M-$60M in Q2, to shut down 55-65 underperforming restaurants and restructure the chain.
    • CMG held a conference call to discuss changes under its new management team, which included additions to its dining menu, a marketing push to raise awareness of mobile ordering, and the launch of a customer loyalty program next year, with testing of the program in H2 of this year.
    • CMG says about half of the store closures will occur in the next 30 days, while closures that involve more complicated lease buyouts will stretch longer.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 6 Comments
  • PIR

    Pier 1 plunges 15% as Q1 same-store sales fall more than expected

    • Pier 1 Imports (NYSE:PIR) -15.3% after-hours despite posting better than expected Q1 earnings, as same-store sales disappoint and Q2 earnings guidance comes in below consensus.
    • PIR says Q1 revenues fell 9% Y/Y to $372M, comparable store sales tumbled 8.2% Y/Y and below company guidance for a 7%-8% decline, and gross profit fell to 32.3% of net sales from 37% in the same period a year ago.
    • PIR issues downside guidance for Q2, seeing an EPS loss of $0.54-$0.58 vs. analyst consensus estimate of a $0.21 loss, with comparable sales expected to decline 6%-7%; for FY 2019, PIR sees a loss of $0.17-$0.36 vs. consensus for a $0.31 loss, with comparable sales expected to rise 1.5%-2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • HFWA

    Heritage Financial +2.4% on move to SmallCap 600

    • Heritage Financial (NASDAQ:HFWA) is up 2.4% after hours on news that it's moving into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It's replacing Kindred Healthcare (NYSE:KND), set to be acquired by a group including Humana (already part of the S&P 500).
    • The move is effective prior to Monday's open.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • PED

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/27/2018)

    • Top Gainers: PED +39%. MSG +7%. HUN +4%. GDS +4%. EQGP +3%.
    • Top Losers: PIR -16%. OTCQB:MOMT -6%. BBBY -5%. ZG -3%. OTCQB:AXIM 3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • ATH

    FT: Athene interested in GE long-term care insurance assets

    • Athene Holding (NYSE:ATH) +2.2% after-hours has expressed interest in acquiring all or parts of General Electric's (NYSE:GE) long-term care insurance business, Financial Times reports.
    • Talks with ATH - the life insurance affiliate of P-E firm Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) - are at an early stage, and GE likely will seek talks with multiple potential buyers, according to the report.
    • In announcing plans for a partial breakup of GE, CEO John Flannery said yesterday the company is "aggressively working on actions and alternatives to mitigate, reduce or eliminate our exposure to long-term care insurance."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM | 29 Comments
  • EDGE

    Edge Therapeutics +45.6% as it discloses study data, strategic update

    • Edge Therapeutics (NASDAQ:EDGE) is up 45.6% after hours after posting an update on its Phase 3 NEWTON 2 study that also contained strategic news.
    • The company says it continues to perform a review of strategic alternatives, having retained Piper Jaffray as an adviser, and those alternatives include "an acquisition, merger, business combination or other strategic transaction involving Edge."
    • It says it's largely completed a worker streamlining, reducing headcount from 37 employees to 13.
    • Edge had discontinued the NEWTON 2 study (of EG-1962 in adults with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage) on the recommendation of a Data Monitoring Committee. The study was designed to detect a 15% absolute improvement in favorable outcomes with a target enrollment of 374 subjects.
    • Before discontinuation, 266 subjects completed a Day 90 follow-up, and 45% of subjects treated with a single intraventricular injection of EG-1962 showed a favorable outcome compared to 41% of subjects treated with oral nimodipine.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow announces Class C, senior note offerings; shares -2.9%

    • Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) plans concurrent public offerings of $325M in shares of its Class C stock and $325M of its convertible senior notes due 2023. The underwriters will have a 30-day option for up to $48.75M in addition shares and notes.
    • Zillow shares are down 2.9% aftermarket to $58.96.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software +4% on Q2 beats, in-line guidance

    • Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) gains 4% aftermarket on Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 3% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q3 guidance has revenue form $95M to $97M (consensus: $97.93M) and EPs form $0.56 to $0.58 (consensus: $0.57).
    • FY18 guidance has in-line revenue of $399M to $404M (consensus: $403.92) and upside EPS from $2.45 to $2.50 (consensus: $2.42). 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Progress Software beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 27)
    • Previously: Progress Software declares $0.14 dividend (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond -5% as same-store sales slipped in Q1

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) -5.6% after-hours as it reports better than expected Q1 earnings but a drop in comparable store sales.
    • While overall net sales edged 0.4% higher Y/Y, Q1 comp-store sales fell ~0.6% vs. expectations for a 0.2% gain: the company says Q1 results include strong sales growth from its customer-facing digital channels as well as from stores that declined in the mid-single-digit percentage range.
    • BBBY reaffirms guidance for FY 2019, seeing EPS in the low-to-mid $2.00 range vs. $2.27 analyst consensus estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • JAZZ

    FDA accepts Jazz Pharma's Xyrem sNDA, PDUFA date Oct. 27

    • Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) announces that the FDA accepted for priority review its sNDA for Xyrem to include an indication for treating cataplexy and excessive daytime sleepiness in pediatric narcolepsy.
    • The PDUFA date is October 27. 
    • Jazz shares are up 0.3% aftermarket to $175.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • ZFGN

    Zafen raising capital; shares down 4.1%

    • The size of the stock offering isn't mentioned. Underwriters (Cowen and Piper) will get a greenshoe option for up to 15% of shares offered.
    • ZFGN -4.1% after hours
    • Source: Press Release
    • Update: On July 2, the company announced that it sold 9.2M shares of common stock at $7.50, including the full exercise of underwriters' option to buy 1.2M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • BHF

    Brighthouse drops to new low, hobbled by bear market

    • Brighthouse Financial (BHF -5.3%) fell 5.3% to close at $40.23, earlier it touched $40.22, its lowest since it was spun off from MetLife (NYSE:MET) last August, and about a little more than a week after its former parent completely shed its stake.
    • Tim Travis, of T&T Capital Management and an SA contributor, says the stock is highly correlated to equity markets, since the "bear market could cause them to increase reserves on the variable annuity business."
    • On June 19, MetLife gave its remaining 23.2M BHF shares to Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS), JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM), Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS), and Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) in exchange for MetLife debt held by the banks.
    • The banks sold the BHF shares in a secondary offering that was priced at $44.50 a share; BHF closed at $45.61 on that day.
    • A few days before the secondary offering, Credit Suisse analyst Andrew Kligerman predicted BHF would fall 5%-8% after the news that MetLife would exit its stake. As a result he cut his price target to $40.50 from $44. Since his note, BHF has fallen 12%.
    • Previously: Brighthouse reports closing of secondary stock offering (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 10 Comments
  • AQXP

    Cantor Fitzgerald slashes its Aquinox target after trial failure

    • Cantor Fitzgerald downgrades Aquinox Pharma (NASDAQ:AQXP) form Buy to Neutral after this morning’s trial failure announcement.
    • Firm slashes the price target from $28 to $2.
    • Aquinox shares are down 85% to $2.29.   
    • Previously: Aquinox Pharma plunges 74% after trial failure (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 9 Comments
  • TM

    Toyota warns on potential tariff, says Camry cost would rise $1,800

    • Toyota (TM -1.5%) warns a 25% tariff on auto imports would increase the cost of every vehicle sold in the U.S., adding to the auto industry’s criticism of the potential imposition of tariffs by Trump administration.
    • 137K Americans "support their families working for Toyota, and Toyota and Lexus dealerships," the company says. "They are not a national security threat. Indeed, Toyota operates 10 manufacturing plants in the U.S. We are an exemplar of the manufacturing might of America."
    • Specifically, TM says its Toyota Camry - made in Georgetown, Ky. - would face $1,800 per vehicle in increased costs.
    • Yesterday, the Alliance of Automobile Manufacturers said a 25% tariff would cost U.S. consumers $45B annually, or $5,800 per vehicle.
    • ETFs: RACE, CARZ
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 12 Comments
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines CEO says higher jet fuel to add $2B to costs this year

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL -1.8%) tumbles after CEO Ed Bastian says the company expects $2B in additional costs this year due to the rising expense of jet fuel.
    • Earlier this month, DAL blamed a 50% annual increase in fuel costs for its decision to lower its Q2 EPS forecast to $1.65-$1.75 from its previous outlook of as much as $2.00/share, and rising jet fuel costs caused American Airlines to cut its full-year profit guidance in April.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 70 Comments
  • FIZZ

    National Beverage sinks 16% in two days as SEC asks questions

    • LaCroix seltzer water maker National Beverage (FIZZ -10.6%) plunges 16% in two days after the SEC raised questions about some of the company’s sales measurements.
    • The SEC asked FIZZ to explain the company's internal performance measures for sales - “velocity per outlet” and “velocity per capita” - which were referenced by CEO Nick Caporella in back-to back press releases last year.
    • The comments piqued the interest of the SEC, which asked FIZZ to put the numbers into context, but the company declined the SEC's request, saying the information “is as secretive as the formulas of our beverages and should not be disclosed to our competition.”
    • “The metrics [the CEO] referenced are used to establish goals for certain customers, but are not utilized to manage the overall executional side of our business,” FIZZ chief accounting officer Gregory Cook told the SEC. “VPO and VPC therefore are not key performance indicators that would give readers a view of the Company through the ‘eyes of management.’”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 20 Comments
  • EGAN

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: EGAN +10%. NIHD +8%. XPLR +8%. MTBC +6%. RMNI +5%.
    • Losers: ABIL -30%. LINK -13%. CBAK-OLD -12%. TSRI -11%. OTCPK:LFIN -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • SMMT

    Summit Therapeutics -80% after discontinuing top drug candidate

    • Summit Therapeutics (SMMT -80.2%) plunges ~80% to a 52-week low after its PhaseOut DMD failed to meet its primary or secondary endpoints after 48 weeks of treatment of ezutromid in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, prompting the company to discontinue development of the drug.
    • "Since our valuation was based mainly on the ezutromid program for DMD, we are downgrading shares to Hold from Buy and reducing our price target to $4 from $22," SunTrust says.
    • Ridinilazole, now SMMT's lead product candidate, is not expected to enter Phase 3 trials until Q1 2019, the firm notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 8 Comments
  • MOMO

    Momo -6.9% on Spruce Point report alleging "serious risks"

    • Spruce Point is out with a report on Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) and sees $23 to $32/share or 30% to 50% downside risk after “primary forensic research” with Spruce’s China-based investigator.
    • Key quote from Spruce: “Momo’s investor base is compromised of two distinct cohorts, fundamental investors taking management’s word at face value and momentum/swing traders trying to play the stock’s trend. Both of these groups are oblivious to the serious risks underpinning a Momo investment.”
    • Momo shares are down 6.9% to $42.20.   
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 36 Comments
  • MXC

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: MXC +15%. ESV +11%. DO +10%. HLX +9%. RDC +8%.
    • Losers: EGO -10%. SBGL -9%. CNXM -9%. TUSK -8%. CEIX -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 9 Comments
  • FB

    Summit Insights gives Twitter Street-high price target

    • Summit Insights is in with Wall Street's highest price target on Twitter (TWTR -1.9%): $52, up from a previous $35.
    • That implies 18.2% upside from current pricing.
    • The platform has opportunities in live sports partnerships and can seize a mantle as the "source of breaking news" particularly with Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) withdrawal there amid data-scandal issues, analyst Jonathan Kees writes. Ad dollars will grow as brands spend more, and international will be a big growth driver. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Twitter shares are up 86.8% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • WAGE

    WageWorks -5.6% after Stifel target cut

    • Stifel maintains a Buy rating on WageWorks (NYSE:WAGE) and lowers its price target from $80 to $64, a 25% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • WageWorks shares are down 5.6% to $48.35.       
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • QQQ

    Tech leads averages lower

    • Markets opened higher after the president relented on Chinese tech investments, but the Nasdaq (QQQ -0.4%) is leading the way lower in afternoon action. The S&P 500 is down just 0.2%.
    • Among tech names with sizable losses are Oracle down 1.5%, Texas Instrument down 1.6%, and Intel down 1.3%.
    • Stumbling markets are helping Treasurys catch a bid, with the 10-year yield down five basis points to 2.83%.
    • Previously: Trump takes softer than expected approach to foreign tech investments (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 14 Comments
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma gets FDA approval for melanoma combo treatment; shares halted

    • The FDA approves Array BioPharma’s (NASDAQ:ARRY) combo treatment of encorafenib and binimetinib for patients with advanced melanoma associated with a BRAF mutation.
    • Array shares were halted at 12:52 PM pending the news. 
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 23 Comments
  • ZEN

    Zendesk gets target boost, appoints first Chief People Officer

    • Morgan Stanley maintains an Overweight rating on Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) but raises the price target from $62 to $65.
    • In other Zendesk news, the company appoints InaMarie Johnson as its first Chief People Officer, a role overseeing human resources, talent acquisition, and workplace experience functions.
    • Johnson was most recently SVP and Chief Human Resources Officer at Plantronics and previously worked in the same role at UTI Worldwide.   
    • Zendesk shares are down 1.5% to $53.66.     
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • DIS

    Justice Dept. signs off on Disney's $71B Fox deal

    • The Justice Dept. made its sign-off official on Disney's $71.3B acquisition of media assets from Twenty-First Century Fox.
    • That comes via a civil antitrust suit filed by the DOJ's antitrust division today, along with a simultaneous settlement that resolves alleged competitive harm by requiring the divestment of 22 Fox regional sports networks.
    • That's a move Disney's already agreed to do, rather than go forward with more delays and face the suit. The settlement deal requires court approval.
    • Under a consent decree, Disney would have 90 days after closing the deal to complete selling off the RSNs, with a possible 90-day extension.
    • “American consumers have benefited from head-to-head competition between Disney and Fox’s cable sports programming that ultimately has prevented cable television subscription prices from rising even higher,” said DOJ antitrust chief Makan Delrahim. “Today’s settlement will ensure that sports programming competition is preserved in the local markets where Disney and Fox compete for cable and satellite distribution.”
    • What's next? The deal needs foreign approvals as well as the OK from shareholders of both companies. No meeting is set as yet.
    • Currently: DIS +0.8%; FOX +1.2%; FOXA +1.6%; CMCSA -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 37 Comments
  • CLDC

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +56%. MXC +22%. MDGS +16%. AINC +14%. ATLC +14%. GALT +13%. EGAN +12%. TRXC +11%. CARA +10%. RKDA +10%.
    • Losers: AQXP -84%. SMMT -80%. PTIE -70%. CVM -39%. ABIL -29%. ASCMA -22%. YECO-OLD -20%. CADC -17%. KZIA -16%. XBIO -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +58%. AINC +14%. ATLC +14%. CCCR-OLD +6%.
    • Losers: FANH -12%. SUPV -9%. BMA -8%. TREE -6%. GEC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • OZM

    Oz Management gains after GE Capital Aviation portfolio deal

    • Oz Management (NYSE:OZM) +3.7% after announcing that it will serve as asset manager for a GE (NYSE:GE) Capital Aviation Services portfolio deal.
    • The gain comes after OZM hit a 52-week low of $1.91 yesterday; its 52-week high of $3.95 occurred on Oct. 30.
    • The agreement starts with the formation of STARR 2018-1, called START Ltd., an entity that will buy a portfolio of aircraft from GECAS. START Ltd. will finance the acquisition with 144A debt and equity.
    • GECAS will service the portfolio and Oz will serve as asset manager.
    • The goal is that Oz will improve liquidity for debt and equity investors by providing providing enhanced investor reporting.
    • Oz will also be an asset manager for potential future transactions, acting on behalf of the syndicated equity investors as an adviser to the board regarding portfolio matters.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: OZ Management appoints Thomas M. Sipp CFO (April 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 10 Comments
  • AU

    Ghana issues environmental permits to reopen AngloGold's Obuasi mine

    • AngloGold Ashanti (AU -2.6%) says it received environmental permits from Ghana's government to reopen its Obuasi mine, paving the way for redevelopment of the mine after halting operations at the end of 2014 after suffering from substantial financial losses.
    • “With the key permitting and regulatory process complete, we will continue to progress the redevelopment of the Obuasi mine as a modern, productive, operation that will benefit a range of key stakeholders for at least two decades,” the company says.
    • AU expects to start gold production at Obuasi by Q3 2019 at an initial cost of $450M-$500M over the first two and a half years, with annual gold production seen averaging 350K-450K oz. during the first 10 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • FORK

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: FORK +7%. THST +7%. KBSF +6%.
    • Losers: JRSH -15%. EAST -9%. CAG -7%. VIRC -7%. FIZZ -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • SCG

    SCANA -3% as South Carolina lawmakers reach deal to cut rates nearly 15%

    • SCANA (SCG -3.7%) sinks after South Carolina lawmakers reach a deal to temporarily lower electric rates by nearly 15% at its SCE&G unit, virtually wiping out the portion of the utility's power bills that customers now pay for the abandoned construction of two unfinished nuclear reactors.
    • The rate cut also could cause Dominion Energy, which has offered to buy out SCG, to withdraw that offer and its proposed benefits, including $1,000 checks to SCE&G customers and a $10/month rate cut, The State reports.
    • SCE&G is expected to challenge the rate cut in court if it is passed and signed into law by the governor, who has said he would veto any proposal that allows SCE&G to continue charging its customers anything for the failed nuclear project.
    • Earlier: South Carolina House votes down 13% SCE&G rate cut as too small (Apr. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 13 Comments
  • DIS

    DJ: DOJ to approve Disney's $71B Fox deal as soon as today (updated)

    • The Justice Dept. is expected to approve Walt Disney's (NYSE:DIS) $71.3B purchase of Fox (FOX, FOXA) media assets as soon as today, Dow Jones is reporting.
    • On the move: DIS +1.4%; CMCSA -0.3%; FOX +1.4%; FOXA +1.8%.
    • Updated 11:55 a.m.: As part of this approval, Disney's agreeing to divest Fox's regional sports networks.
    • Previously: WSJ: Comcast could bring partners for more Fox firepower (Jun. 27 2018)
    • Previously: Murdoch losing as cash components of Fox bids grow (Jun. 26 2018)
    • Previously: Fox filing: Antitrust issues could scuttle Comcast bid (Jun. 26 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 32 Comments
  • GE

    GE climbs another 4% after Oppenheimer upgrade on break-up plans

    • General Electric (GE +3.7%) shoots higher, extending yesterday's 7.7% surge, after Oppenheimer upgrades shares to Perform from Underperform, citing the "potential for [GE's] portfolio plan to unlock some value, and diminish liabilities."
    • "GE can reduce net leverage by $25 billion by 2020, from Healthcare liability transfer (debt and pension) allocation of $18 billion gross and meaningful planned liquidity from break-up moves," analyst Christopher Glynn writes.
    • Glynn is upbeat on GE's break-up plans for its divisions, and estimates the health care unit may fetch $50B in equity value, while the Baker Hughes stake is worth $23.5B and the pending transaction for its transportation unit, expected early next year, could yield a value of more than $12B.
    • Earlier: J.P. Morgan maintains negative view on GE (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 31 Comments
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group +5.8% on Jefferies upgrade

    • Jefferies upgrades Healthcare Services Group (NASDAQ:HCSG) from Hold to Buy and increases the price target from $40 to $53, a 27% upside to yesterday’s close.  
    • Healthcare Services shares are up 5.8% to $44.05. 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • MDGS

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/27/2018)

    • Gainers: MDGS +32%. CARA +21%. GALT +18%. CKPT +14%. APTX +12%.
    • Losers: AQXP -84%. SMMT -80%. PTIE -70%. CVM -46%. DRRX -18%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • I

    Intelsat +10% as Kerrisdale endorses spectrum proposal

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) has jumped 9.9% today as short-seller Kerrisdale Capital Management says it's long on the satellite company's idea to monetize C-band spectrum.
    • Intelsat and SES (SGBAF -0.8%), in partnership with Intel (INTC +0.6%), have proposed sharing satellite spectrum in 3.7 GHz-4.2 GHz with wireless providers as a way of unlocking value.
    • "We are long shares of Intelsat and SES," Kerrisdale says, "an unusual position to be in" given its past attacks on spectrum hype.
    • "But this time, it’s different. Intelsat and SES hold the keys to the right frequencies, in the right way, at the right time, without the irreconcilable interference issues that have beset other spectrum stories," the firm says.
    • The proposal is the best and fastest way to value in this "crucial" spectrum, it says.
    • Previously: Intelsat now up 27% with FCC set to vote on C-band usage (Jun. 20 2018)
    • Previously: Intelsat +9% as RBC raises to Outperform on C-band prospects (Jun. 20 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 15 Comments
  • APC

    Anadarko sees decision on Mozambique LNG export terminal by H1 2019

    • Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3%) says it expects to finalize sales and financing agreements ahead of a final investment decision in H1 2019 to build the first liquefied natural gas export terminal in Mozambique.
    • APC’s executive VP for international, deepwater and exploration Mitch Ingram tells the World Gas Conference in Washington, D.C., that the company is ready to move forward with the Mozambique project after lining up enough deals with customers, approvals from the government and preparing for construction work.
    • The project is in a “sweet spot," Ingram says, because the worldwide slowdown in approvals means there has been less competition both for customers and for suppliers to build the facilities, and it is hitting the contractors “at the low end of the cost cycle."
    • APC and its partners Mitsui of Japan and ONGC Videsh of India expect to spend ~$7.7B for the gas liquefaction and export plant plus an unspecified amount for offshore wells and pipelines, after significant cost reductions over the past couple of years.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • ELTK

    Eltek down 12% post Q1 results

    • Eltek (ELTK -12.1%) reported Q1 revenue growth of 4.7% Y/Y to $8.9M, while still facing issues with its manufacturing operations.
    • Q1 Overall margins: Gross declined by 76 bps to 4.9%, operating recovered by 44 bps to -7% and Adj. EBITDA recovered by 41 bps to -2.07%.
    • Q1 Expenses: SG&A $1.07M (-2.4% Y/Y) and R&D declined by 94.7% Y/Y to 1k.
    • Net cash used in operating activities $856k (+15.34% Y/Y).
    • Company had cash and equivalents of $435k as of March 31, 2018.
    • Previously: Eltek reports Q1 results (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • NVDA

    Raymond James: Buy Nvidia ahead of gaming chip launch

    • Raymond James reiterates Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) at Outperform and $300 price target (24% upside) and says to buy shares ahead of the new gaming chips launching soon.
    • Analyst Chris Caso cites mid-quarter channel partner checks and says the firm feels “very comfortable with our 2H18 estimates for both Gaming and Datacenter following those checks.”
    • Caso has “increased conviction that the October quarter will benefit from a new gaming product cycle, which we expect to be a catalyst and potential source of upside.”
    • The analyst expects Nvidia’s gaming segment sales to increase 10% Q/Q in the October quarter.
    • Nvidia shares are up 1% to $244.44.   
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 70 Comments

  • Crude futures up on sharp inventory decline

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories: Crude -9.9M barrels vs. -2.6M consensus, -5.9M last week.
    • Gasoline +1.2M barrels vs. +1.3M consensus, +3.3M last week.
    • Distillates +0.01M barrels vs. +0.8M consensus, +2.8M last week.
    • Futures +2.5% to $72.30.
    • ETFs:USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, USL, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 102 Comments
  • GBT

    Global Blood Therapeutics target hiked to Street-high $96 at Cantor Fitzgerald

    • Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT -4.4%) is lower as investors apparently overlook positive results for a late-stage trial of its sickle cell disease therapy and instead focus on the company's decision not to enroll any more patients for testing until it finishes discussions with the FDA.
    • CEO Ted Love said earlier this year that GBT planned to enroll ~400 patients in the trial, compared with the 154 patients enrolled in part A, according to MarketWatch.
    • But Cantor Fitzgerald analysts are impressed enough with the results to raise their GBT price target to $96 from $69, saying the trial provides further support of the voxelotor treatment's potential for approval; the firm raises its probability of success for the drug to 75% from 70%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 11 Comments
  • SNAP

    Report: Snap preparing gaming platform for fall

  • DAC

    Danaos jumps 11% post Q1 results

    • Danaos (DAC +11.1%) reported Q1 revenue of $111.85M (+1.6% Y/Y) the increase was due to the re-chartering of certain vessels at higher rates.
    • Q1 overall operating margin improved by 448 bps to 42.7% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 262 bps to 68.5%.
    • Q1 expenses: Vessel operating $26.8M (-2.5% Y/Y), G&A $5.2M (-14.7% Y/%) and Voyage $3.2M (-15.8% Y/Y).
    • Company’s fleet utilization for the quarter was 95.6%, with an average of 55 containerships and an average gross daily charter rate of $23,628.
    • Total contracted revenues were $1.7B as of March 31, 2018, with chatters extending to 2028 and average duration of 5.4 years.
    • “In the near term, we maintain high charter contract coverage of 90% for the next 12 months based on current operating revenues and 81% in terms of contracted operating days. The charter market has stabilized at current levels although trade tensions tend to make liner companies hesitant to commit for longer periods. The benefit, conversely, may be a reduction of speculative ordering or ordering by liner companies, a condition that would improve market conditions”, commented Dr. John Coustas, CEO.
    • Previously: Danaos beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 2 Comments

  • PTE

    PolarityTE responds to Citron Research fraud claims

    • PolarityTE (COOL) responds to the Citron Research report earlier this week accusing the company of fraud in raising money on a rejected patent application, saying the SEC should launch an investigation.
    • PolarityTE says the statements about a “non-final rejection” and a “final rejection” notice from the USPTO refer to office actions, which are a “normal patent prosecution process” with opportunities for the company to respond to the USPTO and the ability to continue prosecution. 
    • The company “strongly disputes” claims that any current directors or officers have sold shares in the past 12 months and says the claim mischaracterizes registration of the securities issuable under an incentive plan, a routine event that doesn’t equal a share sale. 
    • PolarityTE shares were up premarket but dip 0.4% at the open to $26.31.  
    • Previously: PolarityTE -28% after Citron accuses fraud (June 25)

  • CMCSA

    WSJ: Comcast could bring partners for more Fox firepower

    • Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) -- now on the back foot in a bidding war against Disney (NYSE:DIS) for media assets of Fox (FOX, FOXA) -- may tap strategic partners or private equity for more capital, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • That's not the current plan, the report suggests, but it could come into play if bidding hits $90B or so. Disney's $71.3B deal is the one in play at the moment.
    • And it could mean splitting the assets, sending things like U.S. assets to the partner while Comcast holds international broadcast units like Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY) and Star India.
    • Premarket: CMCSA -0.4%; DIS +0.5%; FOX +1.6%; FOXA +1.7%.

  • QCOM

    Trump takes softer than expected approach to foreign tech investments

    • The White House won’t block companies with 25% or more of Chinese ownership from buying certain US tech-related companies, marking a less strict approach than anticipated.
    • The government will rely on the newly strengthened Committee on Foreign Investment in the US (CFIUS) to handle concerns about foreign purchases of sensitive domestic tech, according to a CNBC source. 
    • Stock futures broke turned positive on the news after previously indicating a lower open. 
    • Tech stocks that could move on the news include Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) and NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) since the acquisition deal depends on China’s approval and semiconductor stocks.  
    • Semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH.
    • Qualcomm shares are down 1.6% premarket. NXP shares are up 1.2%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 46 Comments

  • CARA

    Cara Therapeutics reports positive top-line on I.V. CR845

    • Cara Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CARA) reports positive top-line data from the adaptive Phase 2/3 trial of I.V. CR845 in patients undergoing abdominal surgery.
    • I.V. CR845 achieved statistical significance for the primary endpoint of pain relief over the 0 to 24-hour period post-surgery for combined surgeries at the 1.0 mcg/kg dose (p=0.032).
    • Treatment resulted in statistically significant reductions in the secondary endpoint of nausea and vomiting incidence at 24-hours for both the 0.5 and 1.0 mcg doses (p=0.006; p<0.0001).
    • Cara will host a conference call at 8:30 AM to discuss the results with a webcast available here.
    • Cara shares were halted premarket and are expected to resume trading at 7:30 AM. 
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 AM | 13 Comments
  • SMMT

    Summit Therapeutics announces trial failure; shares halted

    • The PhaseOut DMD did not meet its primary or secondary endpoints after 48 weeks of treatment of ezutromid in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy.
    • Summit (NASDAQ:SMMT) is thus discontinuing development of ezutromid, and will be cutting costs. The company will now focus on development of its pipeline of new mechanism antibiotics, with lead candidate ridinilazole expected to enter Phase 3 trials for the treatment of C. difficile infection in Q1 2019.

    • Shares will resume trading at 7:30 ET.
